tool.name: SAM/BAM coverage depth
tool.command: samtools depth #if int($min_len) -l $min_len #end if #if int($base_quality_threshold) -q $base_quality_threshold #end if #if int($mapping_quality_threshold) -Q $mapping_quality_threshold #end if #for i in $input_bam#"${i}" #end for# > "$out_depth"

param.name: min_len
param.label: Minimum mapped length (use zero for none)

param.name: base_quality_threshold
param.label: Base quality threshold (use zero for none)

param.name: mapping_quality_threshold
param.label: Mapping quality threshold (use zero for none)

tool.help:
**What it does**
This tool runs the ``samtools depth`` command in the SAMtools toolkit.
The output is a tabular file, with one line for each base of each reference with any coverage (bases with no coverage may not appear).
The first column is the reference name, the second column is the reference position, and then there is one column for each SAM/BAM file giving the coverage depth at that position.
.. class:: warningmark
**Note**. There is an internal hard limit of 8000 for the pileup routine in samtools, meaning the reported coverage from ``samtools depth`` will show maximum coverage depths *around* 8000.
**Citation**
If you use this Galaxy tool in work leading to a scientific publication please cite:
Heng Li et al (2009). The Sequence Alignment/Map format and SAMtools. Bioinformatics 25(16), 2078-9. http://dx.doi.org/10.1093/bioinformatics/btp352
Peter J.A. Cock (2014), Galaxy wrapper for the samtools depth command http://toolshed.g2.bx.psu.edu/view/peterjc/samtools_depth
